results.title: My journey to strength
results.brief_description: Hilda suffers from deafness and here she gives a frank account of the ups and downs in her life and the traumatic effect of losing her mum just before she turned 18. Through support and determination she has survived years of depression and finally found happiness and acceptance. With subtitles.

results.title: Norbert
results.creator_credit: Michael Hill and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Animated ‘fractured fairytale’ story about Norbert, with abnormally big ears, and the prejudices he faces from the local townsfolk. Being different, Norbert soon discovers, means a lonely and alienated life. A rather bleak piece laced with moments of off-beat black humour. Narrated by V J Shanmugam.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: An Inner passion
results.creator_credit: Hung Lin and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Hand-drawn 2-D animated moral tale of a baker and his assistant and how one person’s passion can inspire and change the actions of their bullying and intolerant boss.
Original music score by James Hodson. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.creator_credit: Juan Serrano and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A computer animated story of myth, magic and power and two alien beings spirited away to planet Earth. No dialogue. Original music score by SISMO.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Tree of us
results.creator_credit: Vilakone Phachanthavong and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Vilakone has created powerful graphics in this animated work about the family of the future through the use of a predominantly red background, with black and white hand-drawn images. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: City of chromatic dissolution
results.brief_description:
Arthur and Corinne Cantrill used footage of Melbourne’s cityscapes and buildings from the mid 1980s to create this evocative piece on movement, colour and the city. The various parts of inner city Melbourne were originally shot on black and white negative in three colour separation, then printed on Eastmancolor film. The results are static shots of the city, where the movement of people and vehicles have a quality that is colour saturated and ghostly. This is complemented with a sountrack both urban and discordant in tone.
This is one of a series of films made by the Cantrills that experiment with dramatic distortions of colour through three-colour separation processes. The original inspiration for this project (as the filmmakers report in the final edition of Cantrills Filmnotes) came back in the mid-1970s when Kodak stopped making the Cantrills’ preferred 16mm reversal colour film stocks.

The results are static shots of the city, where the movement of people and vehicles have a quality that is colour saturated and ghostly. This is one of a series of films made by the Cantrills that experiment with dramatic distortions of colour through three-colour separation processes. The original inspiration for this project (as the filmmakers report in the final edition of Cantrills Filmnotes) came back in the mid-1970s when Kodak stopped making the Cantrills’ preferred 16mm reversal colour film stocks.
